title: kentrolla
author: kentrolla
content: I would like to brief about the current market situation as there has been surge in value of altcoins a much higher surge compared to Bitcoin and many would have utilised this momentum to gain profit but if we look at the other side if you just look for top gainers you will find altcoins with top surge but the next day or after few days if you check the top losers you will find the same top gainers in this list as well. So there is a price increase for altcoin but not a established one like Bitcoin, because we have not seen dump in the value of Bitcoin for over an month now but Altcoins has been pumping and dumping and in my opinion it's not worth to make entery for long term as of now it's good only for quick profit whole being very active. What's your opinion ? Shall we invest or just involve in quick trades ?

comments.author: Publictalk792
comments.body: Thanks for sharing your overview of the current market situation. Many have taken advantage of this momentum and gain profit. But some are waiting still for a dip. But I think they should invest but with their own research. But as you mentioned the top gainers today may become the top losers in the comind. This volatility in altcoins can give you profit and loss both. But if you are a good holder so you will get profit one day.And I will suggest that you should learn some fundamentals of trading and you can get quick profits by getting entry and exit at certain time. In my point of this is also a good method to earn much as you can.

comments.body: It's always risky. For more than a year I was investing in BTC only. I wouldn't recommend it, but I can say my opinion. I think that it's a viable strategy.

comments.author: Hispo
comments.body: Investing in alternative crypocurrencies has been always risky, specially if we are talking about relatively new coins. I would even feel it is risky to try to especulate using coins within the top 50. One needs to be a very well developed sense of economical intuition so one won't get scammed in the wild and obviously scammers take advantage of the bull cycles to try to steal as much as possible from gullible investors, using all kinds of tricks. If I decided to put some money in altcoins, I would only do so in projects which have already been time-proof, like Monero, Litecoin, Ethereum. Nothing with tokens based on food or Dogs. Those are basically shitcoins and a way to  gamble to anyone daring getting money in.

There'll be less risk for me to invest in Ethereum, when I'm ready for altcoins.

comments.author: Essential10
comments.body: Currently Bitcoin price is increasing. Bitcoin investors as well as many are showing interest in altcoins. Choosing the right coin among the many altcoins that most altcoins are risky in the market is the most important. Currently some special altcoin cases have gone public, and this has made the exchange attractive. But we need to support ourselves to acquire proper research and information before investing. We can take appropriate action based on the way we want to gain. Long-term investments are generally based on strong capital appreciation and social change, to maximize potential returns. On the other hand, to maintain rapid transaction price fluctuations, it carries high risk for potential short-term gains. For me the best investment option from altcoins is Bitcoin.

comments.author: inthelongrun
comments.body: There's always risk in everything including investing. But I would rather risk rather than put all savings in a slow-moving and inflationary fiat. It's less than 6 months before the bitcoin halving. And we already know what happens to the crypto market every halving and its following year. So for me, the time to start accumulating altcoins is now. I also started already accumulating altcoins but bitcoin remains my main priority which is around 70% of my portfolio. It is hard to catch the lowest time buying altcoins so for me doing a DCA is highly recommended just like with bitcoin.

comments.author: mindrust
comments.body: Alts are always risky. However there are two kinds of alts lately. There are those absolute shitcoins and there are good alts which has a long history. ETH, Doge, XMR, LTC are good alts for example. These have less risk than the other shitcoins. When you think about it any investment has some risks. The more risky it is, the more potential profits (and losses) it has. If you are a risk taker go on, buy some alts. In 2017 or 2018 there was a guy that turned his $10k alt portoflio into a million USD during that bullrun but since then there weren't any big alt bull runs happened. Maybe you will get lucky like him and become the next millionaire.

comments.author: nelson4lov
comments.body: For someone with a deep pocket, I'd say the risks might not be much compared to someone who is only going to do a one-time buy in with a lump sum. Take Microstrategy for instance, they bought bitcoin around $35K+ at first and they kept buying at different prices (even when bitvoin leveled at $16K at the face of the FTX collapse). They kept buying and that averaged out their average buy in price to subb$20K. Which is why they're in net positive for profits.We can't say the same for someone that will just enter with a lump sum with no more capital to buyback if the price goes lower. The best bet for anyone investing now is to DCA it out because there's a high probability that we might see a market downturn before the mega bull run that everyone is hoping for.
